comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
Was 'Lane Cove Road" the former name for the Pacific Highway? - I recall that Mona Vale Road, was originally Pittwater Road.

My grandparents (mother's side) settled in Wahoonga in 1897 or thereabouts.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Thanks for the tip! You are right about the name change - confusing for latter-day sleuths. I think looking west near the junction with Ada Avenue. 1903 interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm1635-sd&rgn=0... Google street view - see the witches hat turret on Abbotsleigh School for Girls now - maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&...

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
Got it! 

My grandparents built a home in Cleveland Street (before the railway line was built) by chance (or perhaps not) my grandmother's name was Ada. My grandfather was one of the engineers who designed and built- among other great conservation projects - the Burrinjuck Dam. My aunt, their first born daughter, used to talk often about catching the train to Milsons Point and then the ferry to the city. (She was at that stage a nurse working at the Royal Alexandra Hospital for Children). She was the first to awaken my interest in the history of our city and inter-alia its modes of transport.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00] Which is where mum, and her two sisters went to school!

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
Gordon used to be called Lane Cove.
Thats why Lane Cove Road in Ryde is the road to Gordon and not the road to Lane Cove.
